is a seaside resort located on the Adriatic Sea coast of the Friuli-Venezia Giulia region, in the North-Eastern part of

.

It is one of favored summer holiday retreats of the Germans and Swiss in the nearby north, who come for the pristine beaches, active nightlife, and culture.
The municipality is divided into three different districts:

value: the western part of the peninsula is prodominantly residential, with small villas, and low rise condos set amongst pine trees.
right in the centre of the town, features a modest commercial center, popular beaches, and a plethora of night life venues.
at the Eastern end of the peninsula, contains a bustling commercial center, soaring high rise condominiums and yet even more nightlife and cultural venues than Pineta.

Most people arrive by car. Close to Trieste airport and also Venice Airport.

value: content=This hotel enjoys a marvellous location on the sea front, surrounded by the lush greenery of pine trees.

content=This hotel lies in the historical area of the town, directly facing the beach promenade. Parking places and beach service are included in the room rates, while interesting last-minutes are available on the their web site.
content=Family-managed establishment, completely renovated, in a quiet area, nestled in the pinewoods.
content=This hotel in Lignano Sabbiadoro was entirely restored in its furnishings and it offers 31 rooms situated in four floors. The hotel has a lift and a Wi-Fi coverage in the building.

, Corso degli Alisei 11. The oldest Internet café in town,  open every day non-stop from 7:00am until 2:00am. 16 multimedia PCs where users can surf the Internet or play Internet and network games. B/w printing available upon request. The local also offers wireless Internet access: guests can surf the Internet with their own laptop using a WiFi high-speed connection. Please note that in Italy a personal document is required in order to be allowed  surfing from a public Internet access like the Internet café.
, just one hour away from Lignano.
